info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 8:13AM CDT until April 19 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Stone and Taney.
* WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, Wolf Creek at Highway 125, Stout Creek at Hulls Ford Road, Trigger Creek at Highway J, Caney Creek at Caney Creek RD, Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road and Roark Creek at Expressway Lane. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods, Reeds Spring, Rockaway Beach, Indian Point, Branson West, Taneyville, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Table Rock, Kirbyville, Blue Eye, Coney Island, Powersite, Ozark Beach, Edgewater Beach, Walnut Shade, Ridgedale, Bradleyville, Rueter, Brownbranch, Lampe, Lake Taneycomo, Table Rock Lake, Bull Shoals Lake, Shepherd of the Hills State Park and Table Rock State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
